div1.p: HAVE YOU EN10OLLE. FOR THE SUMME WORK. SHOP AT THE PI BETA PHI SETTLEMENT . SCHOOL, GATLIN URG, TENNESSEE JUNE 12 TO JULY 20, 1946? DON'T DELAY as accommodations are scarce, and classes may need to be limited to available equipment. COME to the second Workshop offered by Pi Beta Phi and the University of Tennessee. LEARN TO CREATE beautiful handicraft articles. PARTICIPATE in planned recreation, and learn the secret of directing community recreation. HAVE A PROFITABLE AND PLEASANT VACATION in the beautiful Smoky Mountains learning, creating, and playing. . University Credit or non-credit courses. Co-Directors: Elsa Ulbricht, Milwaukee State Teachers College and Founder of Milwaukee Handicraft Project Weaving and Textile Decoration Marion Heard, University of Tennessee Jewelry and Metalcraft Recreational Crafts Other Instructors include: Harriett Gill, Berea, Kentucky Woodcraft and Toymaking Josephine Arnquist Bakke, Iowa State College Community Recreation For further details write Miss Ruth Dyer, Pi Beta Phi Settlement School, Gatlin-burg, Tennessee. (Limited number of room and board scholarships available in return for assistance in Settlement School dining room.) 392
